title: How to Take Professional Product Photos for Your Online Store
content:
Why Product Photos Are Crucial

In e-commerce, customers can't touch the product. The photo is the only way to convince them to buy. Studies show that:

  • 93% of consumers consider images the key factor in purchasing decisions
  • 22% of returns result from the product looking different than in the photo
  • Products with multiple images sell 58% better

Marketplace Requirements

Amazon

  • Main image: pure white background (RGB 255,255,255)
  • Minimum resolution: 1000x1000 px (recommended 2000x2000)
  • Product occupies at least 85% of the frame
  • No text, logos, watermarks

eBay

  • Min 500x500 px (recommended 1600x1600)
  • White or light background
  • Up to 12 images per listing

Etsy

  • Minimum 2000x2000 px recommended
  • First photo should show the entire product
  • Lifestyle photos encouraged

Equipment - Do You Need a Professional Studio?

Good news: You don't need expensive equipment to take great product photos.

Basic Setup (under $200):

  • Smartphone with good camera (iPhone 12+, Samsung S21+)
  • Phone tripod (~$20)
  • Lightbox / shadowless tent (~$40-80)
  • LED light with softbox (~$50)

Advanced Setup:

  • Mirrorless or DSLR camera
  • Macro lens for small products
  • Studio lighting system
  • Professional backgrounds

Product Photography Techniques

1. Lighting

Light is the foundation. Best options:

  • Natural light - photograph by a window, avoid direct sunlight
  • Softbox - soft, even light without harsh shadows
  • Ring light - ideal for small products

2. Shooting Angles

Show the product from multiple perspectives:

  • Front view (main image)
  • Side view
  • Top view (flat lay)
  • Detail close-ups
  • Lifestyle shot (product in use)

3. Camera Settings

  • ISO: as low as possible (100-400)
  • Aperture: f/8-f/11 for sharp product
  • White balance: adjust to lighting
  • Format: RAW if possible, for more editing flexibility

Photo Editing Workflow

Even the best photo needs editing. Here's the optimal workflow:

Step 1: Basic Correction

  • Cropping and straightening
  • Exposure and contrast adjustment
  • White balance

Step 2: Background Removal

Use AI Background Remover to automatically remove the background and replace it with clean white.

Step 3: Upscaling (if needed)

If the image resolution is too low, use AI Upscaler to enlarge 2-4x without quality loss.

Step 4: Packshot Generation

For a professional effect, the Packshot Generator will add realistic shadows and reflections.

Common Mistakes

1. Bad Lighting

Too dark, too bright, uneven - this is immediately visible. Invest time in setting up lights.

2. Blurry Product

Use a tripod! Even minimal hand shake causes blur.

3. Distracting Background

Background should be invisible. If you don't have a studio, simply remove it in post-production.

4. Too Low Resolution

Photograph at the highest quality. You can always downsize, but upscaling (without AI) ruins quality.

5. Inconsistent Style

All photos in the store should have the same style - same background, similar lighting, consistent framing.

Automation with AI

Checklist Before Publishing

Before adding a photo to your store, check:

  • Resolution meets platform requirements
  • Background is clean and uniform
  • Product is sharp and well-lit
  • Colors are true to reality
  • No dust, smudges, defects
  • File isn't too heavy (optimized)

Summary

Professional product photos are an investment that pays off. Thanks to modern AI tools, even small stores can have photo quality comparable to big brands.
